key_title: Key to the varieties of Vittadinia australasica

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Vittadinia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1999). Vittadinia. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Involucral bracts to 9 mm long, minutely pubescent with glandular hairs only; leaves and stems glandular, often viscid, if longer eglandular hairs present also, then sparse and largely confined to leaf- margins
Involucral bracts to 6 mm long, with scattered strigose eglandular hairs mixed with short glandular hairs; leaves and stems distinctly strigose-pubescent, not viscid, glandular hairs often indistinct
